channel.title: SMF help ssi_topTopics();
channel.description:
I have SMF's ssi added to my website's homepage, but I don't want it to show the default 10 posts. I find that to be too much clutter on my page. So I wanted to limit it to 3-4. I don't know how to do this. Upon searching, I found this:
array ssi_topTopics ([string $type[, int $num_topics[, string $output_method]]])
and then a description on what each does. That can be found [url=http://support.simplemachines.org/function_db/index.php?action=view_function;id=518]here.[/url]
I don't know how to modify it, as I'm not good at php at all. So yeah, some help or an example would be awesome.

item.title: SMF help ssi_topTopics();
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:10, topic:490144”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=608377.msg4231785#msg4231785 date=1361323635]
Here:


$return_type = "replies"; //replies or views
$return_amt = 4; //amount you want to return
$output_meth = "array"; //output method either array or echo

ssi_topTopics($return_type, $return_amt, $output_meth);

That should work.
[/quote]
I actually just edited SSI. I dont plan on using toptopics anywhere else but if I do ill just use what you posted. you need to get on skypeee[/quote]
nevereverevereverevereverever edit the SSI young paddawan. I’ll get on now :).

Read full topic

item.title: SMF help ssi_topTopics();
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:490144”][quote author=Ecko link=topic=608377.msg4230755#msg4230755 date=1361252554]
You have to edit SSI.php to that. Search for:

function ssi_topTopics($type = 'replies', $num_topics = 10, $output_method = 'echo') {
[/quote]
Why would you ever edit the SSI.php? Return it as an array if you want to display it different ways.

This is also documented pretty well on the SMF website.[/quote]

You really didn’t read my post did you. The link I posted was to the smf support site…
I said I don’t know how to actually use it…

Read full topic

Why would you ever edit the SSI.php? Return it as an array if you want to display it different ways.

This is also documented pretty well on the SMF website.
